newsitem.title: UK: Nigeria plans 50,000 bpd cut in Nov refining runs.
newsitem.headline: Nigeria plans 50,000 bpd cut in Nov refining runs.

text.p: Nigeria in November plans to run 50,000 barrels per day (bpd) less crude through domestic refineries than in October, leaving more for export, a Nigerian official said on Friday.

Nigeria's petroleum ministry told Nigerian National Petroleum Corp (NNPC) that domestic refineries would need 250,000 bpd of crude supply in November, compared to 300,000 bpd in October, the official said.
The lower refining runs would provide an extra cargo for export in November, the official said.
The ministry gave no reason for the expected reduction in crude runs, but Nigeria's four refineries, with a nominal capacity of 445,000 bpd, have been plagued by operational problems.
